qas.question: What was the prototype for the Ferranti Mark 1?
What was the first available computer for the public?
When was the Ferranti Mark 1 built?
Where was the Ferranti Mark 1 sent to after it was developed?
When was the LEO 1 computer first operational?

context: <a0_0>The Mark 1<a0_0/> in turn quickly became the prototype for the <a1_0>Ferranti Mark 1<a1_0/>, the world's first commercially available general-purpose computer. Built by Ferranti, it was delivered to the <a3_0>University of Manchester<a3_0/> in February <a2_0>1951<a2_0/>. At least seven of these later machines were delivered between 1953 and 1957, one of them to Shell labs in Amsterdam. In October 1947, the directors of British catering company J. Lyons & Company decided to take an active role in promoting the commercial development of computers. The LEO I computer became operational in <a4_0>April 1951<a4_0/>  and ran the world's first regular routine office computer job.
